column4: are you supposed to lose all of your settings, customizations, and installed apps when you upgrade to a new version of ubuntu?
If you upgrade using a package manager then no, if you reinstall then yes (unless you keep /home on a seperate partition)
Ubuntu uses "dpkg" to handle Debian packages, and "APT" as the main package manager. There are loads of GUIs for APT (update-manager, synaptic, adept, aptitude,etc.)
Maybe it was incompatible for some reason (using an  older, conflicting library or something?)
